svcproc.title: Removing Engine and Generator From Chassis

step1.para: Pull out 150A main fuse at batteries.
Remove generator cover − eight bolts.
Remove alternator air intake shroud − four screws.
Disconnect capacitor plug.
Remove back plate − four stator nuts.
Re-install four stator nuts on to bearing housing assembly.
Disconnect stator wires from APU conduit wires by cutting apart the butt-splice insulated connectors. Be careful to mark the wires so that reconnections are correct.
Remove generator vibration mount bolts.
Remove negative cables from starter housing and re-install starter bolt.
Remove positive cables from starter solenoid.
Unplug starter solenoid signal wire #12.
Unplug coolant temperature sensor and cut wire tie.
Remove #17 wire from oil pressure switch.
Remove #15 wire from coolant temperature switch.
Unplug run solenoid (3-wire connector) and cut wire ties.

figure.caption: Figure 26. Removing Engine and Generator from Chassis

step1.para: Unplug speed sensor (3 wires) and cut wire ties.
Pull main wire harness away from the engine and allow to hang from right side.
Remove air filter and intake hose (if necessary). Tape over engine intake to avoid debris from entering into the engine.
Undo spring clip and remove fuel inlet hose from low-pressure fuel pump. Cut wire ties.
Undo spring clip from fuel return hose from the tee closest to the truck frame.
Remove exhaust clamp from muffler and pry exhaust pipe from muffler.
Remove engine vibration mount bolts.
Drain APU/engine coolant.
Remove coolant inlet and outlet hoses from engine.
Remove engine/generator assembly from chassis using either an engine hoist and chains or a jack under the oil pan. (Be sure to secure engine/generator so that it cannot fall off jack).
